tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]

tn.ref: Does Israel have no children? Is there no one to inherit anything in Israel? Why does Molech occupy Gad, and his people live in its cities?
tn.text: AT: "There are plenty of Israelites to inherit the land of Israel. The people who worship the false idol, Molech, should not live in Gad." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "Look and listen".
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:07:31|07:32]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|01:8]].
cry out loud
The women in the city of Rabbah

tn.ref: Why are you proud of your strength?
tn.text: AT: "You should not be so proud because you really are not strong." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"You falsely think that no one can defeat you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The word "you" refers to the people of Ammon.
AT: "go in different directions".
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|01:8]].

tn.ref: Has good advice ... understanding? Has their wisdom become corrupted?
tn.text: The same idea is expressed in two different ways. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Has good advice disappeared from those who have understanding?
tn.text: "It seems that there are no longer any wise people in Teman district in Edom!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"Their advice is no longer wise." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Edom.
"Those who harvest grapes always leave some on the vines." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"When thieves come at night, they surely steal only as much as they want." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]j
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Edom.
AT: "Look, listen, or pay attention"
AT: "experience punishment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Do you yourself think you will go without punishment?
tn.text: AT: "Certainly, you must be aware that you will personally experience my punishment for your sins. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The words "you" and "yourself" refer to Edom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]]
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|01:8]].
Jeremiah is now speaking to the people of Edom.
The word "I" refers to Jeremiah.
The word "her" refers to Edom.
The word "I" refers to Yahweh.
The word "you" refers to the nation of Edom.
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Edom.
AT: " live in safety like an eagle in the heights of the mountains" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|01:8]].
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Edom.
AT: "shake from fear and speak of their displeasure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah
tn.text: AT: "in the way Sodom and Gomorrah were destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: no one will live there; no person will stay there
tn.text: Yahweh says the same thing twice to emphasize that Edom will be completely uninhabited. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Edom.
AT: "Look, listen, pay attention".
This is another way of saying that the attack will be fierce and unexpected. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: For who is like me, and who will summon me?
tn.text: Yahweh uses the question to point out the smallness of humans. AT: " No one is like me, no one orders me around". (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"order someone to come"

tn.ref: What shepherd is able to resist me?
tn.text: Yahweh uses the question to show no one can defeat him. "Shepherd" here is a metaphor for "king," "ruler." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
the people who live in Teman

tn.ref: They will certainly be dragged away, even the smallest flock
tn.text: AT: "He will drag them away, even the smallest flock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Their pasturelands will be turned into ruined places
tn.text: AT: "He will turn their pasturelands into ruined places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Pastureland is land covered with grass where animals feed on the grass.
The word "their" refers to Edom.

tn.ref: At the sound of their falling the earth shakes. The sound of distressed shouts is heard at the Sea of Reeds
tn.text: The purpose of this exaggeration is to tell the failure of Edom will be severe. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
AT: "Look, listen, pay attention".

tn.ref: attack like an eagle, and swoop down and spread his wings
tn.text: The attack will be vicious and unexpected. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
a city (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: become like the heart of a woman in birth labor
tn.text: "feel overwhelmed and full of dread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Yahweh tells what will happen to the people of Damascus.
This is a Syrian city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
AT: "They are scared!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: They become as troubled as the sea
tn.text: Their emotions are compared to a troubled sea. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: like the pain of a woman giving birth.
tn.text: The suffering of the city is compared to the pain of a woman giving birth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: How is the famous city, the city over which I have rejoiced, not yet evacuated?
tn.text: AT: "It cannot be that the famous city, the city where there was so much joy and happiness should still have people in it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Damascus.
The word "its" refers to the Damascus.

tn.ref: the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|01:8]].
This the name of the king. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Jeremiah speaks about what will happen to Kedar.
The name of a group of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The name of a place in the biblical and modern Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Kedar.

tn.ref: Stay in holes in the ground
tn.text: "Stay hidden" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"people who live in Hazor"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|01:8]]
"made a plan"
The words "They" and "them" refer to the people who feel safe and secure.
"go in all different directions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Then I will scatter to every wind those who cut the corners of their hair
tn.text: AT: "Then I will send in all different directions those who do not obey my commands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: No one will live there; no human being will stay there
tn.text: These two lines mean basically the same thing and emphasize that Hazor will be completely uninhabited. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh is speaking about what will happen to Elam.
men who are skilled with a bow and arrows

tn.ref: four winds from the four corners
tn.text: "4 winds from the 4 corners". (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
AT: "all directions, everywhere". (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: There is no nation to which those scattered from Elam will not go.
tn.text: AT: "The refugees from Elam will be forced to seek refuge absolutely everywhere throughout the world." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to Elam.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
AT: "send their enemies to kill them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "I will establish my rule over" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
